Title: What Is the Purpose of Totem Poles?
Article:
Totem Poles are large wooden poles that are beautifully carved with many symbols.
The totem pole of the Red Indians provided a means of communicating their stories, myths, and legends. They were generally carved from giant trees, and were made up of an arrangement of symbols. The symbols of a totem pole told a story, or recalled an event. These messages and stories tell us a lot about the Red Indians and their culture.
Some poles were erected to celebrate cultural benefits; others were just an artistic presentation. Certain poles also contained graves within them. But whatever their purpose, totem poles are awesome.
